title: 34-Mile 2024 Porsche 911 S/T
description: This 2024 Porsche 911 S/T is #489 of 1,963 produced and was specified with the Heritage Design package, a $20k option. The car was acquired new by the seller from Porsche of Rockford, Illinois, and it now has 34 miles. Finished in Shore Blue Metallic over Classic Cognac leather, it is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Features include 20″ and 21″ center-lock wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a front-axle lift system, LED-Matrix Design headlights with PDLS+, an extended-range fuel tank, rear ParkAssist sensors, carbon-fiber bucket seats, the Chrono Package, Porsche Communication Management, a Bose surround sound system, automatic climate control, and cruise control. This 992 S/T is now offered with a window sticker, a car cover, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name, listing it as a 911 GT3 RS.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 34-Mile 2024 Porsche 911 S/T at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #198,515.
text: This 2024 Porsche 911 S/T is #489 of 1,963 produced and was specified with the Heritage Design package, a $20k option. The car was acquired new by the seller from Porsche of Rockford, Illinois, and it now has 34 miles. Finished in Shore Blue Metallic over Classic Cognac leather, it is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Features include 20″ and 21″ center-lock wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a front-axle lift system, LED-Matrix Design headlights with PDLS+, an extended-range fuel tank, rear ParkAssist sensors, carbon-fiber bucket seats, the Chrono Package, Porsche Communication Management, a Bose surround sound system, automatic climate control, and cruise control. This 992 S/T is now offered with a window sticker, a car cover, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name, listing it as a 911 GT3 RS. The 992 S/T was introduced in 2024 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the 911 and features lightweight construction with carbon-fiber-reinforced plastic (CFRP) panels, lightweight glass, reduced insulation, and magnesium wheels. Taking its name from a series of 911 Group 4 race cars produced between 1970 and 1972 with 911S mechanicals beneath the lighter 911T, the 992 S/T features GT3 Touring styling with a GT3 RS drivetrain. This example is finished in Shore Blue Metallic and features LED-Matrix Deisgn headlights with PDLS+, auto-dimming mirrors with integrated rain sensors, a rear fog light, rear ParkAssist sensors, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The Heritage Design package added contrasting graphics and gold-finished badging commemorating the 60th anniversary of the 911 in 2023. The 20″ and 21″ forged-magnesium center-lock wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 255/35 up front and 315/30 at the rear. Braking is handled by black-finished Porsche-script calipers over Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB), and the car was optioned with a front-axle lift system. The cabin features carbon-fiber bucket seats trimmed in Classic Cognac leather with patterned inserts along with a matching lower dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include Porsche Communication Management, a Bose surround sound system, ambient lighting, the Storage Package, automatic climate control, and cruise control. A numbered gold plaque denotes the car as #489 of 1,963 in the series. The GT3 sports steering wheel features a centering stripe and a drive-mode selector dial, and it frames instrumentation finished in a classic green scheme including a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline as well as a digital speed readout and dual configurable TFT screens. A Sport Chrono stopwatch is mounted atop the center of the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 34 miles. The 4.0-liter flat-six features direct fuel injection, VarioCam variable valve timing, dry-sump lubrication, and individual throttle bodies. It was factory rated at 518 horsepower and 342 lb-ft of torque. The car was optioned with an extended-range fuel tank. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a lightweight clutch and single-mass flywheel assembly. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche Rockford in Illinois, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $328,900. The Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage. An odometer reading of 100 is listed in August 2024. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 2024 Porsche 911 S/T is #489 of 1,963 produced and was specified with the Heritage Design package, a $20k option. The car was acquired new by the seller from Porsche of Rockford, Illinois, and it now has 34 miles. Finished in Shore Blue Metallic over Classic Cognac leather, it is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six that drives the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle. Features include 20″ and 21″ center-lock wheels, carbon-ceramic brakes, a front-axle lift system, LED-Matrix Design headlights with PDLS+, an extended-range fuel tank, rear ParkAssist sensors, carbon-fiber bucket seats, the Chrono Package, Porsche Communication Management, a Bose surround sound system, automatic climate control, and cruise control. This 992 S/T is now offered with a window sticker, a car cover, manufacturer’s literature, a clean Carfax report, and a clean Illinois title in the seller’s name, listing it as a 911 GT3 RS.

The 992 S/T was introduced in 2024 to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the 911 and features lightweight construction with carbon-fiber-reinforced plastic (CFRP) panels, lightweight glass, reduced insulation, and magnesium wheels. Taking its name from a series of 911 Group 4 race cars produced between 1970 and 1972 with 911S mechanicals beneath the lighter 911T, the 992 S/T features GT3 Touring styling with a GT3 RS drivetrain.

This example is finished in Shore Blue Metallic and features LED-Matrix Deisgn headlights with PDLS+, auto-dimming mirrors with integrated rain sensors, a rear fog light, rear ParkAssist sensors, and dual center-exit exhaust outlets. The Heritage Design package added contrasting graphics and gold-finished badging commemorating the 60th anniversary of the 911 in 2023.

The 20″ and 21″ forged-magnesium center-lock wheels are mounted with Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires measuring 255/35 up front and 315/30 at the rear. Braking is handled by black-finished Porsche-script calipers over Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB), and the car was optioned with a front-axle lift system.

The cabin features carbon-fiber bucket seats trimmed in Classic Cognac leather with patterned inserts along with a matching lower dash, center console, and door panels. Amenities include Porsche Communication Management, a Bose surround sound system, ambient lighting, the Storage Package, automatic climate control, and cruise control.

A numbered gold plaque denotes the car as #489 of 1,963 in the series.

The GT3 sports steering wheel features a centering stripe and a drive-mode selector dial, and it frames instrumentation finished in a classic green scheme including a central tachometer with a 9k-rpm redline as well as a digital speed readout and dual configurable TFT screens. A Sport Chrono stopwatch is mounted atop the center of the dashboard. The digital odometer indicates 34 miles.

The 4.0-liter flat-six features direct fuel injection, VarioCam variable valve timing, dry-sump lubrication, and individual throttle bodies. It was factory rated at 518 horsepower and 342 lb-ft of torque. The car was optioned with an extended-range fuel tank.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle with a lightweight clutch and single-mass flywheel assembly.

The window sticker shows initial delivery to Porsche Rockford in Illinois, and lists factory colors, equipment, and a total price of $328,900.

The Carfax report indicates no accidents or other damage. An odometer reading of 100 is listed in August 2024.
